page.title: 11Modern Blacksmith & Farrier
page.content: Working as a farrier in 1985 was very different from years ago when he made all his own tools.A Blacksmith made everything from a nail to horse drawn implements.He made all the shoes he put on horses.Very often he made his own horse shoe nails,and also tools like pincers,knives,buffers for taking shoes off,sugar beet hooks,turnip picks and hand hoes.All cart_wheels were shod with iron tires by the local blacksmith.All this work was done on a coal forge which was blown by hand bellows,and a lot of sweat.Today's blacksmith and farrier uses factory _made shoes and tools which are to a high standard.He travels from his forge to the horses by car,sometimes travelling many miles a day and is kept very busy. by Michael Bacon.
